etymology.interpretation: Combines the phonetic 棥, giving the reading fán, with a semantic element 𠬜 associated with grasping or obstructing, evoking the idea of impediment. The stacked-wood phonetic also suggests brushwood used to make enclosures, reinforcing the sense of a fence or barrier.

examples.chinese: 这道围墙像一道樊篱，阻隔了两边的交流。(這道圍牆像一道樊籬，阻隔了兩邊的交流。)
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào wéiqiáng xiàng yīdào fánlí, zǔgé le liǎng biān de jiāoliú.
examples.english: This wall is like a barrier, blocking communication between the two sides.

examples.chinese: 他姓樊，来自湖北。(他姓樊，來自湖北。)
examples.english: His surname is Fan, and he is from Hubei.

examples.chinese: 诗中写“世俗之樊”，表达束缚之意。(詩中寫「世俗之樊」，表達束縛之意。)
examples.pinyin: Shī zhōng xiě “shìsú zhī fán”, biǎodá shùfù zhī yì.
examples.english: In the poem it says “the fetters of the mundane world,” conveying the idea of constraint.
